Given the importance of the historical record, and the fact that that some of our digitised collections include materials that are sensitive to particular communities and groups, we ask that any use of the digitised collections is undertaken with the appropriate care. notesStmt.note: Leaves stuck on paper (modern restoration). Folios damaged at the beginning and at the end. Lacuna after folio 3, 5, 37. Folios 1-5 and 14 are later restorations. Defective at the beginning and at the end.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A service book, according to the Yemenite rite.

supportDesc.foliation: Folio 155 was originally followed by folio 158, folios 156-157 having been inserted later.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Yemenite semi-cursive script of the 17th century, puctuated. Zekharia ben Se῾adyah Alma῾alim: inscribed, folio 177v.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Prayerbook. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2673.'

history.provenance:
Acquisition:
Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 10 October 1883: inscribed, folio [228v].
